data.title: Great breakfast
data.text: Great breakfast place.  Outstanding pancakes.  Very friendly staff and reasonably priced.  Would recommend for sure .

data.title: Affordable, fresh, yummy!
data.text: After a morning walk on the beach, we strolled around town looking for a good place to eat breakfast. Just as we were about to enter the bagel shop, we spotted this place (we first noticed the many diners eating on the patio, and saw the sign). Service and food were excellent. Very unique menu items (my son had a seafood omelette), ingredients were very fresh, as was the salsa that came with the meal. Omelettes were priced $9-$15 and came with yummy potatoes, toast, and salsa. Decor was cute and the crowd was diverse (a good combo of locals and visitors).

data.title: Food Good, Service Poor
data.text: Although the food ended up being great! We had to wait about 20 minutes just to get asked if we wanted something to drink,  this was not a busy time for them, maybe about 6 tables including us.  As soon as the gentleman brought us our drinks, we figured we better keep him there and order our main dishes and appetizer.  Took about another 20 minutes to get our food delivered to the table and was never asked if we wanted a refill on our coffee and tea.  We did get a young waitresses attention to get our bill, which again was a challenge.  If you all  have the time, a lot of time, enjoy your meal.  Bathrooms are a couple flights of stairs under the restaurant.

data.title: Excellent find!
data.text: I am surprised that the reviews are not higher for this place.  We were quite pleased with the service, quality and taste of food coupled with the very reasonable prices.  I ordered the Veggie omelette (which came with broccoli and cauliflower) and was skeptical, but it was really, really good.  My wife ordered the "Popeye" and raved about it.  I also asked for a bowl of fruit and, quite honestly, I expected rubbish fruit, but was pleasantly surprised with the nice mix.  I highly recommend this place.

data.title: So good---so many choices!
data.text: Our hotel staff in The Pike recommended this place for breakfast.  It was wonderful!  There were many, many omelette choices and the food was delicious.  Would love to go back and try other omelettes!

data.title: Love this place - best pancakes ever!
data.text:
I came to this place for breakfast with my boyfriend after it was recommended by our uber driver (we were on vacation in long beach), Honestly, this is the perfect little breakfast place to go to! The banana chocolate chip pancakes are so good!! They are huge, very thick and extremely tasty! 

They also have a lot of other food choices too, the omelettes are amazing as my boyfriend ordered one - you could really taste the cheese and the omelette was cooked perfectly.

We was only in long beach for 10 days, but had to visit this place twice!

If you are looking for some yummy breakfast, Omlette in is the place to go!

data.title: Perfect breakfast place!!
data.text:
This is a GREAT place to go for breakfast or brunch!
Went there twice while on stay in long beach on vacation from London which says a lot of how good it was the first time.
The chicken fiesta omelette was amazing and comes with a lot (cottage cheese and bread) and is also very big and filling! 
The best food was definitely the chocolate chip and Banana pancakes which were AMAZING and hug and for only $5 you get 2 big ones.
Service is also quick which is great!!
Definitely recommended a probably give it a 4.5* if I could

data.title: Good little place
data.text: Stopped in for breakfast here on a business trip. The eggs and bacon were cooked just right. Would go back again.

data.title: Great choice
data.text: We come here every time we're in Long Beach. Great and freshly made food. Everyone is very kind. Eggs Benedict are superb. Very reasonable price

data.title: Hidden Gem!
data.text: Ate here for breakfast with wife and daughter, great food and good service!  Will be back.  We had pancakes, eggs, ham steaks, all good.

data.title: Great food, fast, and close to the hotel we were at.
data.text: A bit pricey, but very accommodating to my requests.  The have a wide variety of menu items and everything I have tried has been excellent.  Be sure to get the homemade salsa.  Free, but by request only.

data.title: Second year visiting -- this place is a keeper!
data.text: We were sent here by the employee of the 7-11 down the street last year. It is now a must for breakfast every day we are at the Long Beach Grand Prix! The breakfasts are perfect! I like a healthy omelette and it is perfect. Hubby likes the pancakes with syrup. We are both happy!

data.title: Savor any omelette combination you can imagine
data.text: Great spot to meet friends for a marvelous breakfast right downtown. Extensive menu of egg dishes and they will add items you want, even if it's not on the menu.

data.title: Outstanding Omelettes
data.text:
I'm not one who can suffer through a stale breakfast line at your local hotel.  I enjoy walking around and looking for a local establishment to eat breakfast especially one that is not a brand-name. I found my new favorite spot in Long Beach called the omelette Inn. 

The proportions were Huge and I took half of my omelette back to the hotel to eat later, so if you were with somebody else you may be able to share. The waitstaff were Johnny on the spot with all drinks refills and needs. 

I quietly watched them seat and serve at least 25 people during the hour I was there all with the precision you would expect and a smile. If you were staying downtown Long Beach and looking for a great place for breakfast I highly recommend this outstanding joint!

data.title: Great homestyle food, big portions!
data.text: Very good food -- we shared portions due to size of servings. Endless coffee, reasonably priced.  Worth the visit!

data.title: A favourite
data.text: I haven't been to Long Beach for a few years &I was happy to visit recently.  The Omelette Inn has moved since last time but The breakfasts are even better than I remember.  The Mexican style breakfast burrito is fantastic & the omelettes are great. Large & filling & everything is freshly prepared.  The staff are very nice too. I enjoyed it so much that I didn't bother having breakfast anywhere else during my stay. Highly recommended.

data.title: Great breakfast!
data.text: Went with 3 friend and we were all impressed. My friend said her omelette was the best she's ever had. My breakfast burrito was great and the raisin toast seemed home made. Would definitely go back!

data.title: Fresh and good
data.text: Had the ABC (avocado, bacon & cheddar) omelette & home fries, both good and very filling. Asked for salsa, which few restaurants have, and it was fresh & tasty!  It did take awhile to get my order though. Beware of that 1st step if you need the restroom, because it's down a staircase. Note they moved from 3rd, which is where I went looking.

data.title: Plentiful Plates!
data.text: We were staying nearby at the Hyatt and looking for a breakfast place other than the hotel restaurant.  The concierge recommended this diner-like place which had both outdoor and indoor seating.  The menu offered everything you could want for breakfast.  We ordered omelettes which came with a number of sides (hash browns, toast, muffins, etc).  I tried the omelette with bacon and avocado - delicious!  The plates are plentiful so you will not leave hungry!  We liked it so much that we returned a few days later because we wanted to try the pancakes - which were gargantuan (filled the entire plate)!  The muffins are also made in-house.  The morning we were there, they offered a walnut-pumpkin one which was outstanding!  I'm glad I don't live in Long Beach - I'd probably go to this place every morning!  Definitely worth a visit  . . .  or two!

data.title: Freshly cooked
data.text: I went lunchtime-ish, but there were few other customers, and I had to wait awhile before getting any service or shown a table.  However, once I finally got seated, the menu was produced quickly and order taken.  I chose the veggie omelette, and it was freshly cooked and very nice. The home style cooked potatoes though were absolutely delicious.  They put up a large parasol outside, but actually I preferred to make the most of the sunshine (and sit under the sun) so they strategically placed it to get the best of both worlds! It was lovely to sit outside, on the sunny side of the road. My husband raves about this restaurant and really recommends the chilli/Mexican omelette (the last omelette featured on the list on the menu).
